roleset.name: to cause to happen
roleset.note: PRECIPITATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'precipitate' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from precipitate.01-v predicate notes)
PRECIPITATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia for unification

example.name: transitive
example.text: The British press , [*-2] making a mountain out of a molehill , precipitated an unnecessary economic crisis by [*-2]portraying Mrs. Thatcher as an autocrat who [*T*-1] had thrown economic policy into confusion by [*-3] driving a respected figure from her government .
example.arg: [*-2] making a mountain out of a molehill
by [*-2] portraying Mrs. Thatcher as an autocrat who [*T*-1]had thrown economic policy into confusion by [*-3] driving a respected figure from her government

roleset.name: rain/snow/etc.
roleset.note: PRECIPITATE-V NOTES: Added by Julia for unification
PRECIPITATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Corresponds to VNcls weather-57. (from precipitation.01-n)

role.descr: the watery substance falling from the sky

example.name: TMP
example.text: The amount of precipitation for December was a little ABOVE normal .
